abstract: The New Jersey governor has decided not to run for president, citing his commitment to "fix a broken New Jersey" first.
snippet: The New Jersey governor has decided not to run for president, citing his commitment to "fix a broken New Jersey" first.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has decided not to seek the presidency, citing a promise he made to his state's voters when he took office 20 months ago to "fix a broken New Jersey." The decision ends a late flurry of indecision on the part of Mr. Christie, who had been encouraged by a growing number of Republican donors and activists who hoped he join the field of candidates vying to challenge President Obama. Read (and comment on) the full story on The Caucus.
